stories.text:
Overall impressed with the UI/UX progress made on Windows 11. The old UI is still present in some dialogs, but it feels much more refined (closer to what macOS provides), and updates will make it more consistent.

https://www.theverge.com/22708762/microsoft-windows-11-review

Managing virtual desktops is made easy (other systems got this right a long time ago)

https://www.theverge.com/22728778/windows-11-virtual-desktop-workspace-how-to

Arranging windows is so welcome

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=JDAsJRs2aFk

Start-up apps can be turned off, as well as Cortana, and ‘Gaming’ performance mode as been introduced, which I believe takes care of keeping background services to a minimum.

Still exploring, but been using both macOS and Windows, more macOS but lately Windows, this update feels like a much awaited breakthrough.
stories.title: Windows 11 getting basics right with better UI/UX
